meanings.definition: The upper part or surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The bird landed on the topwork of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully painted the topwork of the fence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot on the topwork of the roof.
meanings.sent4: The clouds covered the topwork of the mountain like a fluffy blanket.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight illuminated the topwork of the building, making it shine.

meanings.definition: To graft a scion onto the top of a rootstock.
meanings.sent1: The gardener decided to topwork the apple tree with a new branch.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to topwork roses in her horticulture class.
meanings.sent3: The farmer accidentally tried to topwork a pumpkin onto a tomato plant.
meanings.sent4: He skillfully topworked the grapevine, creating a hybrid variety.
meanings.sent5: The botanist demonstrated how to topwork different fruit trees for better yield.

meanings.definition: To add a new layer of material to the top of something.
meanings.sent1: The chef decided to topwork the cake with fresh strawberries.
meanings.sent2: She carefully topworked the table with a beautiful tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The artist playfully topworked glitter onto the painting.
meanings.sent4: He topworked the driveway with a layer of smooth asphalt.
meanings.sent5: The decorator topworked the room with elegant curtains and cushions.
